as	O	O

.	O	O

fold	O	O

INTRODUCTION	O	O
Many	O	O
women	O	O
in	O	O
low	O	O
-	O	O
income	O	O
countries	O	O
suffer	O	O
from	O	O
sub	O	O
-	O	O
optimal	O	O
micronutrition	O	O
as	O	O
a	O	O
consequence	O	O
of	O	O
eating	O	O
diets	O	O
which	O	O
are	O	O
often	O	O
low	O	O
in	O	O
animal	O	O
-	O	O
source	O	O
foods	O	O
and	O	O
which	O	O
do	O	O
not	O	O
meet	O	O
dynamic	O	O
micronutrient	O	O
requirements	O	O
throughout	O	O
the	O	O
reproductive	O	O
lifecycle	O	O
(	O	O
Bartley	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
2005	O	O
).	O	O

Although	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
commonest	O	O
cause	O	O
of	O	O
nutritional	O	O
morbidity	O	O
worldwide	O	O
(	O	O
Stoltzfus	O	O
2003	O	O
),	O	O
in	O	O
women	O	O
of	O	O
reproductive	O	O
age	O	O
concurrent	O	O
deficiencies	O	O
of	O	O
vitamins	O	O
A	O	O
,	O	O
C	O	O
,	O	O
B	O	O
and	O	O
folate	O	O
also	O	O
frequently	O	O
occur	O	O
and	O	O
all	O	O
contribute	O	O
to	O	O
an	O	O
increased	O	O
anaemia	O	O
risk	O	O
(	O	O
Huffman	O	O
SL	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
1998	O	O
).	O	O

The	O	O
prevention	O	O
of	O	O
multiple	O	O
micronutrient	O	O
deficiencies	O	O
as	O	O
a	O	O
strategy	O	O
to	O	O
reduce	O	O
the	O	O
risk	O	O
of	O	O
prenatal	O	O
anaemia	O	O
has	O	O
been	O	O
little	O	O
studied	O	O
and	O	O
attention	O	O
has	O	O
tended	O	O
to	O	O
focus	O	O
instead	O	O
on	O	O
iron	O	O
supplementation	O	O
during	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
conflicting	O	O
results	O	O
(	O	O
Reveiz	O	O
et	O	O

2007	O	O

few	O	O

in	O	O
non	O	O

women	O	O
of	O	O
reproductive	O	O

and	O	O

have	O	O

in	O	O
Africa	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
The	O	O
Gambia	O	O
,	O	O

of	O	O
sub	O	O

UNIMMAP	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
balanced	O	O
preparation	O	O
of	O	O

vitamins	O	O

Fund	O	O
,	O	O
World	O	O
Health	O	O

United	O	O
Nations	O	O

for	O	O

and	O	O

The	O	O
composition	O	O
of	O	O
UNIMMAP	O	O
is	O	O
shown	O	O
inTable	O	O
1	O	O
(	O	O

/	O	O
WHO	O	O
/	O	O
UNU	O	O
1999	O	O
).	O	O

a	O	O

years	O	O
old	O	O
.	O	O

Exclusions	O	O
were	O	O

for	O	O

as	O	O
required	O	O
.	O	O

to	O	O

to	O	O

one	O	O

daily	O	O
.	O	O

were	O	O

to	O	O
attend	O	O
weekly	O	O

in	O	O
their	O	O

they	O	O
were	O	O

with	O	O

.	O	O

Compliance	O	O
with	O	O
supplementation	O	O
was	O	O
assessed	O	O
by	O	O
pill	O	O
counts	O	O
(	O	O
compliance	O	O
factor	O	O
=	O	O
ratio	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
tablets	O	O
apparently	O	O
consumed	O	O
/	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
days	O	O
enrolled	O	O
in	O	O
study	O	O
).	O	O

Information	O	O
on	O	O
morbidity	O	O
and	O	O
menstrual	O	O
patterns	O	O
was	O	O
also	O	O
recorded	O	O
at	O	O
these	O	O
visits	O	O
.	O	O

Subjects	O	O
were	O	O

to	O	O
notify	O	O
fieldworkers	O	O
of	O	O
suspected	O	O

women	O	O
received	O	O
a	O	O

antenatal	O	O
preparation	O	O
of	O	O
60mg	O	O

250μg	O	O
of	O	O
folic	O	O
acid	O	O
daily	O	O
.	O	O

were	O	O

study	O	O

who	O	O

PMMST	O	O

least	O	O

of	O	O

or	O	O

current	O	O

.	O	O

Data	O	O

for	O	O

between	O	O

this	O	O

was	O	O

DISCUSSION	O	O
To	O	O
our	O	O
knowledge	O	O
this	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
first	O	O
African	O	O
trial	O	O
to	O	O
evaluate	O	O
the	O	O

of	O	O
multiple	O	O

supplementation	O	O
on	O	O

cell	O	O
parameters	O	O
and	O	O
iron	O	O
status	O	O
among	O	O
non	O	O
-	O	O
pregnant	O	O
women	O	O
of	O	O
reproductive	O	O
age	O	O
.	O	O

Twelve	O	O
months	O	O
of	O	O
daily	O	O
MMN	O	O
supplementation	O	O
significantly	O	O
improved	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
concentration	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
group	O	O
of	O	O
women	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
associated	O	O
decrease	O	O
in	O	O
ZnPP	O	O
concentration	O	O
and	O	O
increased	O	O
MCV	O	O
in	O	O
supplemented	O	O
women	O	O
suggests	O	O
that	O	O
the	O	O
iron	O	O
content	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
supplements	O	O
underpinned	O	O
the	O	O
improved	O	O
haematological	O	O
profile	O	O
,	O	O
while	O	O
the	O	O
differences	O	O
in	O	O
reticulocyte	O	O
count	O	O
suggest	O	O
a	O	O
reduction	O	O
in	O	O
red	O	O
cell	O	O
turnover	O	O
among	O	O
MMN	O	O
supplemented	O	O
women	O	O
.	O	O

Anaemia	O	O
prevalence	O	O
was	O	O
almost	O	O
halved	O	O

and	O	O
anaemic	O	O
women	O	O

the	O	O
greatest	O	O
increase	O	O
in	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
concentration	O	O
following	O	O
supplementation	O	O
(+	O	O
1	O	O
.	O	O
2g	O	O
/	O	O
dL	O	O
).	O	O

This	O	O
would	O	O
be	O	O
expected	O	O
as	O	O
subjects	O	O
who	O	O
are	O	O
iron	O	O

iron	O	O

than	O	O
those	O	O
who	O	O
are	O	O

(	O	O

-	O	O

et	O	O
al	O	O
2004	O	O
).	O	O

ESR	O	O
was	O	O
measured	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
study	O	O
.	O	O

ESR	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
non	O	O
-	O	O
specific	O	O
,	O	O
indirect	O	O
measurement	O	O
of	O	O
plasma	O	O
acute	O	O
-	O	O
phase	O	O
protein	O	O
and	O	O
systemic	O	O
inflammatory	O	O
status	O	O
that	O	O
is	O	O
known	O	O
to	O	O
correlate	O	O
with	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
and	O	O
plasma	O	O
fibrinogen	O	O
concentrations	O	O
(	O	O
Kanfer	O	O
and	O	O
Nicol	O	O
1997	O	O
).	O	O

It	O	O
is	O	O
influenced	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
size	O	O
,	O	O
shape	O	O

and	O	O

of	O	O
erythrocytes	O	O

by	O	O
other	O	O

such	O	O
as	O	O

(	O	O
Brigden	O	O
1999	O	O

Gabay	O	O
and	O	O
Kushner	O	O
1999	O	O
).	O	O

Interpretation	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
effect	O	O
of	O	O
supplementation	O	O
on	O	O
ESR	O	O
is	O	O
complex	B	B
(	O	O

and	O	O

1976	O	O

but	O	O

could	O	O
indicate	O	O
a	O	O

of	O	O
MMN	O	O
on	O	O
systemic	O	O
inflammation	O	O
.	O	O

However	O	O
,	O	O
there	O	O
was	O	O
no	O	O

that	O	O
CRP	O	O

of	O	O

markers	O	O
and	O	O

in	O	O

of	O	O

endemicity	O	O

study	O	O
was	O	O

to	O	O

the	O	O

of	O	O
the	O	O
study	O	O

placebo	O	O
and	O	O

at	O	O

high	O	O

regular	O	O
follow	O	O
-	O	O
up	O	O
and	O	O

in	O	O
the	O	O

.	O	O

The	O	O
placebo	O	O
control	O	O
group	O	O

of	O	O
the	O	O

of	O	O

on	O	O
haematological	O	O
parameters	O	O

The	O	O
primary	O	O
analysis	O	O
was	O	O

in	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
concentration	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
limited	O	O

of	O	O
this	O	O
study	O	O

functional	O	O
effect	O	O
of	O	O
MMN	O	O
supplementation	O	O
on	O	O
nutritional	O	O

However	O	O

of	O	O

and	O	O

a	O	O

outcome	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
main	O	O
trial	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
will	O	O
be	O	O
reported	O	O
elsewhere	O	O
.	O	O

was	O	O
a	O	O
low	O	O

of	O	O
malaria	O	O
parasitaemia	O	O

sampling	O	O
of	O	O
partially	O	O
immune	O	O
adults	O	O

in	O	O

season	O	O

in	O	O
an	O	O
area	O	O
of	O	O
highly	O	O
seasonal	O	O
endemicity	O	O
.	O	O

Although	O	O
there	O	O
was	O	O
no	O	O
difference	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
rate	O	O
of	O	O
clinical	O	O
infection	O	O
diagnosis	O	O
between	O	O
the	O	O

arms	O	O

parent	O	O
trial	O	O
,	O	O
longitudinal	O	O
malaria	O	O
exposure	O	O
may	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
an	O	O
effect	O	O
modifier	O	O
or	O	O
confounding	O	O
variable	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
study	O	O
and	O	O
ought	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
assessed	O	O
formally	O	O
in	O	O
future	O	O
work	O	O
.	O	O

Iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
is	O	O
an	O	O

and	O	O
snoring	O	O
during	O	O
early	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
.	O	O

Results	O	O
from	O	O
screening	O	O
and	O	O
diagnostic	O	O
testing	O	O
for	O	O
gestational	O	O
diabetes	O	O

(	O	O
GDM	O	O
)	O	O
were	O	O
abstracted	O	O
from	O	O
medical	O	O
records	O	O
.	O	O

Generalized	O	O
linear	O	O
models	O	O
were	O	O
fitted	O	O
to	O	O
derive	O	O
relative	O	O
risk	O	O
(	O	O
RR	O	O
)	O	O
and	O	O
95	O	O
%	O	O
confidence	O	O
intervals	O	O
(	O	O
95	O	O
%	O	O
CIs	O	O
)	O	O
of	O	O
GDM	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
snoring	O	O
,	O	O
respectively	O	O
.	O	O

Results	O	O
After	O	O
adjusting	O	O
for	O	O
maternal	O	O
age	O	O
and	O	O
race	O	O
/	O	O
ethnicity	O	O
,	O	O
GDM	O	O
risk	O	O
was	O	O
increased	O	O

sleeping	O	O
≤	O	O
4	O	O
hours	O	O
compared	O	O
with	O	O
those	O	O
sleeping	O	O
9	O	O
hours	O	O
per	O	O
night	O	O
(	O	O
RR	O	O
=	O	O
5	O	O
.	O	O

;	O	O
95	O	O
%	O	O
CI	O	O
1	O	O
.	O	O

-	O	O

).	O	O

corresponding	O	O
RR	O	O
for	O	O
lean	O	O
women	O	O
(<	O	O
25	O	O
kg	O	O
/	O	O
m2	O	O

was	O	O

.	O	O
23	O	O
(	O	O
95	O	O
%	O	O
CI	O	O
0	O	O
.	O	O
34	O	O
-	O	O

.	O	O

(≥	O	O

,	O	O

was	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

-	O	O
fold	O	O

of	O	O

(	O	O
RR	O	O

The	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O
9	O	O
-	O	O
fold	O	O

of	O	O
GDM	O	O
(	O	O
95	O	O
%	O	O

2	O	O

87	O	O
-	O	O
16	O	O
.	O	O
6	O	O
).	O	O

Conclusions	O	O
These	O	O
preliminary	O	O
findings	O	O
suggest	O	O
associations	O	O
of	O	O
short	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
snoring	O	O
with	O	O
glucose	O	O
intolerance	O	O
and	O	O
GDM	O	O
.	O	O

Though	O	O
consistent	O	O
with	O	O
studies	O	O
of	O	O
men	O	O
and	O	O
non	O	O
-	O	O
pregnant	O	O
women	O	O
,	O	O
larger	O	O
studies	O	O
that	O	O
include	O	O
objective	O	O

of	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
,	O	O
quality	O	O
and	O	O
apnea	O	O
are	O	O
needed	O	O
to	O	O
obtain	O	O
more	O	O
precise	O	O
estimates	O	O
of	O	O
observed	O	O
associations	O	O
.	O	O

Background	O	O
Insufficient	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
poor	O	O
sleep	O	O
quality	O	O
are	O	O
considered	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
endemic	O	O
in	O	O
modern	O	O
society	O	O
.	O	O

Findings	O	O
from	O	O
epidemiological	O	O
and	O	O
animal	O	O
experimental	O	O
studies	O	O
indicate	O	O
that	O	O
chronic	O	O
partial	O	O
sleep	O	O
loss	O	O
is	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
increased	O	O
risks	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
and	O	O
a	O	O
myriad	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
-	O	O
related	O	O
disorders	O	O
including	O	O
impaired	O	O
glucose	O	O
tolerance	O	O
,	O	O
hypertension	O	O
,	O	O
diabetes	O	O
,	O	O
metabolic	O	O
syndrome	O	O
,	O	O
coronary	O	O
heart	O	O
disease	O	O
,	O	O
stroke	O	O
and	O	O
premature	O	O
mortality	O	O
[	O	O
1	O	O
-	O	O
8	O	O
].	O	O

The	O	O
impact	O	O
of	O	O
short	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
on	O	O
the	O	O
risk	O	O
of	O	O
diabetes	O	O
has	O	O
been	O	O
shown	O	O
in	O	O
several	O	O
epidemiological	O	O
studies	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
significant	O	O
increases	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
incidence	O	O
of	O	O
diabetes	O	O
among	O	O
individuals	O	O
who	O	O
report	O	O
habitual	O	O
short	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
those	O	O
who	O	O
report	O	O
having	O	O
difficulty	O	O
maintaining	O	O
sleep	O	O
[	O	O
4	O	O
,	O	O
9	O	O
-	O	O
11	O	O
].	O	O

Moreover	O	O
,	O	O
accumulating	O	O
evidence	O	O
link	O	O
habitual	O	O
snoring	O	O
and	O	O
sleep	O	O
apnea	O	O
,	O	O
both	O	O
part	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
spectrum	O	O
of	O	O
sleep	O	O
-	O	O
related	O	O
breathing	O	O
disorders	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
cardiometabolic	O	O
abnormalities	O	O
that	O	O
include	O	O
hypertension	O	O
,	O	O
dyslipidemia	O	O
,	O	O
obesity	O	O
,	O	O
hyperglycemia	O	O
,	O	O
insulin	O	O
resistance	O	O
and	O	O
type	O	O
2	O	O
diabetes	O	O
[	O	O
2	O	O
,	O	O
7	O	O
,	O	O
12	O	O
-	O	O
15	O	O
].	O	O

Although	O	O
the	O	O
exact	O	O
mechanisms	O	O
underlying	O	O
these	O	O
associations	O	O
have	O	O
yet	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
fully	O	O
elucidated	O	O
,	O	O
evidence	O	O
from	O	O
experimental	O	O
studies	O	O
suggest	O	O
that	O	O
insufficient	O	O
sleep	O	O
and	O	O
sleep	O	O
fragmentation	O	O
result	O	O
in	O	O
metabolic	O	O
and	O	O
neuroendocrine	O	O
alterations	O	O
,	O	O
particularly	O	O
alterations	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
hypothalamic	O	O
-	O	O
pituitary	O	O
adrenal	O	O
(	O	O
HPA	O	O
)	O	O
axis	O	O
,	O	O
that	O	O
may	O	O
contribute	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
development	O	O
of	O	O
impaired	O	O
glucose	O	O
tolerance	O	O
,	O	O
insulin	O	O
resistance	O	O
and	O	O
type	O	O
2	O	O
diabetes	O	O
mellitus	O	O
[	O	O
16	O	O
-	O	O
20	O	O
].	O	O

Moreover	O	O
,	O	O
experimental	O	O
studies	O	O
in	O	O
humans	O	O
[	O	O
21	O	O
,	O	O
22	O	O
]	O	O
and	O	O
animals	O	O
[	O	O
23	O	O
,	O	O
24	O	O
]	O	O
have	O	O
demonstrated	O	O
that	O	O
intermittent	O	O
hypoxia	O	O
,	O	O
known	O	O
to	O	O
occur	O	O
in	O	O
sleep	O	O
apnea	O	O
,	O	O
exerts	O	O
adverse	O	O
effects	O	O
on	O	O
glucose	O	O
metabolism	O	O
.	O	O

Most	O	O
sleep	O	O
studies	O	O
,	O	O
however	O	O
,	O	O
have	O	O
excluded	O	O
pregnant	O	O
women	O	O
;	O	O
hence	O	O
very	O	O
little	O	O
is	O	O
known	O	O
about	O	O
how	O	O
insufficient	O	O
sleep	O	O
and	O	O
sleep	O	O
disordered	O	O
breathing	O	O
during	O	O
gestation	O	O
contribute	O	O
to	O	O
increased	O	O
risks	O	O
of	O	O
medical	O	O
complications	O	O
of	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
including	O	O
gestational	O	O
diabetes	O	O
mellitus	O	O
(	O	O
GDM	O	O
).	O	O

To	O	O
the	O	O
best	O	O
of	O	O
our	O	O
knowledge	O	O
no	O	O
one	O	O
has	O	O
evaluated	O	O
the	O	O
impact	O	O
of	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
snoring	O	O
on	O	O
maternal	O	O
glucose	O	O
metabolism	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
this	O	O
pilot	O	O
study	O	O
,	O	O
we	O	O
assessed	O	O
associations	O	O
of	O	O
maternal	O	O
self	O	O
-	O	O
reported	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
snoring	O	O
during	O	O
early	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
with	O	O
glucose	O	O
intolerance	O	O
and	O	O
a	O	O
diagnosis	O	O
of	O	O
GDM	O	O
later	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
.	O	O

We	O	O
analyzed	O	O
maternal	O	O
plasma	O	O
glucose	O	O
concentrations	O	O
1	O	O
hour	O	O
after	O	O
a	O	O
50	O	O
-	O	O
gram	O	O
oral	O	O
glucose	O	O
challenge	O	O
as	O	O
part	O	O
of	O	O
routine	O	O
mid	O	O
-	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
screening	O	O
for	O	O
GDM	O	O
.	O	O

We	O	O
hypothesized	O	O
that	O	O
maternal	O	O
habitual	O	O
short	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
and	O	O
snoring	O	O
during	O	O
early	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
were	O	O
positively	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
post	O	O
load	O	O
glucose	O	O
concentrations	O	O
later	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
and	O	O
with	O	O
an	O	O
increased	O	O
risk	O	O
of	O	O
clinically	O	O
diagnosed	O	O
GDM	O	O
.	O	O

Methods	O	O
Study	O	O
population	O	O
and	O	O
setting	O	O
This	O	O
preliminary	O	O
(	O	O
pilot	O	O
)	O	O
study	O	O
is	O	O
based	O	O
on	O	O
data	O	O
collected	O	O
from	O	O
a	O	O
cohort	O	O
of	O	O
women	O	O
attending	O	O
prenatal	O	O
care	O	O
clinics	O	O
affiliated	O	O
with	O	O
Swedish	O	O
Medical	O	O
Center	O	O
in	O	O
Seattle	O	O
,	O	O
Washington	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
cohort	O	O
study	O	O
was	O	O
designed	O	O
to	O	O
evaluate	O	O
the	O	O
influence	O	O
of	O	O
maternal	O	O
diet	O	O
,	O	O

activity	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
other	O	O
life	O	O
style	O	O
factors	O	O
on	O	O
the	O	O
occurrence	O	O
of	O	O
preeclampsia	O	O
,	O	O
gestational	O	O
diabetes	O	O
mellitus	O	O
and	O	O
other	O	O
adverse	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
outcomes	O	O
.	O	O

Eligible	O	O
women	O	O
initiated	O	O
prenatal	O	O
care	O	O
before	O	O
20	O	O
weeks	O	O
gestation	O	O
,	O	O
were	O	O
18	O	O
years	O	O
of	O	O
age	O	O
or	O	O
older	O	O
,	O	O
could	O	O
speak	O	O
and	O	O
read	O	O
English	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
planned	O	O
to	O	O
carry	O	O
the	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
to	O	O
term	O	O
and	O	O
to	O	O
deliver	O	O
at	O	O
either	O	O
hospital	O	O
.	O	O

At	O	O
14	O	O
weeks	O	O
gestation	O	O
,	O	O
on	O	O
average	O	O
,	O	O
participants	O	O
reported	O	O
sociodemographic	O	O
,	O	O
behavioral	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
health	O	O
characteristics	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O
structured	O	O
interview	O	O
.	O	O

After	O	O
delivery	O	O
,	O	O
study	O	O
personnel	O	O
abstracted	O	O
data	O	O
from	O	O
participants	O	O
'	O	O
hospital	O	O
labor	O	O
and	O	O
delivery	O	O
medical	O	O
records	O	O
and	O	O
clinic	O	O
records	O	O
.	O	O

Between	O	O
December	O	O
2003	O	O
and	O	O
July	O	O
2006	O	O
,	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
393	O	O
(	O	O
82	O	O
%)	O	O
of	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
685	O	O
approached	O	O
women	O	O
consented	O	O
to	O	O
participate	O	O
.	O	O

We	O	O
sequentially	O	O
excluded	O	O
12	O	O
women	O	O
with	O	O
early	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
losses	O	O
,	O	O
52	O	O
who	O	O
were	O	O
lost	O	O
to	O	O
follow	O	O
-	O	O
up	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
23	O	O
who	O	O
did	O	O
not	O	O
complete	O	O
the	O	O
interview	O	O
.	O	O

We	O	O
also	O	O
excluded	O	O
16	O	O
women	O	O
with	O	O
pre	O	O
-	O	O
gestational	O	O
diabetes	O	O
.	O	O

Thus	O	O
,	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
290	O	O
women	O	O
remained	O	O
for	O	O
analysis	O	O
.	O	O

All	O	O
study	O	O
procedures	O	O
were	O	O
approved	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
Institutional	O	O
Review	O	O
Board	O	O
of	O	O
Swedish	O	O
Medical	O	O
Center	O	O
.	O	O

All	O	O
participants	O	O
provided	O	O
written	O	O
informed	O	O
consent	O	O
.	O	O

Description	O	O
of	O	O
covariates	O	O
At	O	O
the	O	O
time	O	O
of	O	O
enrollment	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
study	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
45	O	O
to	O	O
60	O	O
-	O	O
minute	O	O
structured	O	O
questionnaire	O	O
was	O	O
administered	O	O
by	O	O
a	O	O
trained	O	O
interviewer	O	O
.	O	O

Information	O	O
on	O	O
medical	O	O
and	O	O
reproductive	O	O
histories	O	O
and	O	O
sociodemographic	O	O
and	O	O
lifestyle	O	O
characteristics	O	O
including	O	O
average	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
hours	O	O
of	O	O
sleep	O	O
before	O	O
and	O	O
during	O	O
early	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
was	O	O
collected	O	O
.	O	O

Maternal	O	O
average	O	O
nightly	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
during	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
was	O	O
ascertained	O	O
by	O	O
asking	O	O
women	O	O
the	O	O
following	O	O
question	O	O
:	O	O
"	O	O
Since	O	O
becoming	O	O
pregnant	O	O
,	O	O
how	O	O
many	O	O
hours	O	O
per	O	O
night	O	O
do	O	O
you	O	O
sleep	O	O
?"	O	O

A	O	O
similar	O	O
question	O	O
was	O	O
asked	O	O
for	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
before	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
.	O	O

Responses	O	O
were	O	O
recorded	O	O
as	O	O
integers	O	O
.	O	O

For	O	O
bivariate	O	O
analyses	O	O
,	O	O
we	O	O
classified	O	O
participants	O	O
into	O	O
4	O	O
sleep	O	O
duration	O	O
categories	O	O
:	O	O
≤	O	O
4	O	O
,	O	O
5	O	O
-	O	O
8	O	O
,	O	O
9	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
≥	O	O
10	O	O
hours	O	O
,	O	O
respectively	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
cut	O	O
-	O	O
points	O	O
were	O	O
based	O	O
on	O	O
categorizations	O	O
used	O	O
in	O	O
prior	O	O
research	O	O
[	O	O
4	O	O
,	O	O
11	O	O

and	O	O

[	O	O

of	O	O

HPA	O	O

and	O	O

and	O	O
release	O	O
have	O	O

for	O	O
these	O	O

can	O	O

that	O	O

[	O	O
19	O	O
].	O	O

dysregulation	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
HPA	O	O
axis	O	O
with	O	O
consequent	O	O
elevations	O	O
in	O	O
serum	O	O
cortisol	O	O
[	O	O
16	O	O
,	O	O
45	O	O
].	O	O

In	O	O
a	O	O
community	O	O

sample	O	O
of	O	O
2	O	O

751	O	O
middle	O	O
aged	O	O
men	O	O

vitamin	O	O

adult	O	O
ontogenetic	O	O
stages	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O
porcine	O	O
model	O	O
.	O	O

an	O	O

basis	O	O
,	O	O

(	O	O

,	O	O
6	O	O
%	O	O

an	O	O
adequate	O	O
protein	O	O
diet	O	O
(	O	O
AP	O	O
,	O	O
12	O	O
%	O	O

to	O	O

on	O	O

for	O	O

].	O	O

to	O	O

of	O	O

.	O	O

Results	O	O
.	O	O

Evidence	O	O
-	O	O
based	O	O
preventive	O	O
treatment	O	O
options	O	O
for	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
anaemia	O	O

include	O	O
prophylaxis	O	O
iron	O	O
supplements	O	O
and	O	O
food	O	O

with	O	O
iron	O	O
.	O	O

abounds	O	O
on	O	O
their	O	O

in	O	O

the	O	O

of	O	O

deficiency	O	O

in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
.	O	O

,	O	O

are	O	O

by	O	O
side	O	O

.	O	O

of	O	O

.	O	O

1	O	O
.	O	O

Introduction	O	O
Iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
anaemia	O	O
is	O	O
defined	O	O
as	O	O
anaemia	O	O
accompanied	O	O
by	O	O
depleted	O	O
iron	O	O
stores	O	O
and	O	O
signs	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
compromised	O	O
supply	O	O
of	O	O
iron	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
tissues	O	O
[	O	O
1	O	O
].	O	O

There	O	O
is	O	O
variation	O	O
in	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
levels	O	O
during	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
;	O	O
at	O	O
the	O	O
beginning	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
,	O	O
there	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
normal	O	O
reduction	O	O
in	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
level	O	O
followed	O	O
by	O	O
a	O	O
slight	O	O
rise	O	O
towards	O	O
the	O	O
end	O	O
of	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
[	O	O
2	O	O
].	O	O

The	O	O
initial	O	O
reduction	O	O
has	O	O
been	O	O
explained	O	O
to	O	O
result	O	O
from	O	O
increased	O	O
red	O	O
cell	O	O
mass	O	O
and	O	O
demands	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
fetus	O	O
which	O	O
exceeds	O	O
iron	O	O
intake	O	O
with	O	O
consequent	O	O
reduction	O	O
in	O	O
iron	O	O
stores	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
woman	O	O
'	O	O
s	O	O
body	O	O
[	O	O
2	O	O
].	O	O

Thus	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
World	O	O
Health	O	O
Organization	O	O
has	O	O
defined	O	O
anaemia	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
as	O	O
a	O	O
haemoglobin	O	O
value	O	O
below	O	O
11	O	O
g	O	O
/	O	O
dL	O	O
[	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
3	O	O
].	O	O

There	O	O
are	O	O
two	O	O
known	O	O
factors	O	O
which	O	O
contribute	O	O
to	O	O
development	O	O
of	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
anaemia	O	O
(	O	O
IDA	O	O
)	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
;	O	O
the	O	O
first	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
woman	O	O
'	O	O
s	O	O
iron	O	O
stores	O	O
at	O	O
the	O	O
time	O	O
of	O	O
conception	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
second	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
amount	O	O
of	O	O
iron	O	O
absorbed	O	O
during	O	O
gestation	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
fact	O	O
that	O	O
anaemia	O	O
frequently	O	O
does	O	O
occur	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
among	O	O
women	O	O
in	O	O
developing	O	O
countries	O	O
is	O	O
an	O	O
indication	O	O
that	O	O
preexisting	O	O
iron	O	O
stores	O	O
are	O	O
often	O	O
inadequate	O	O
and	O	O
physiological	O	O
adaptations	O	O
to	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
are	O	O
insufficient	O	O
to	O	O
meet	O	O
the	O	O
increased	O	O
requirements	O	O
[	O	O
4	O	O
].	O	O

Hence	O	O
,	O	O
iron	O	O
supplementation	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
has	O	O
become	O	O
a	O	O
standard	O	O
and	O	O
routine	O	O
practice	O	O
as	O	O
a	O	O
preventive	O	O
treatment	O	O
for	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
anaemia	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
in	O	O
developing	O	O
countries	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
view	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
foregoing	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
review	O	O
of	O	O
effectiveness	O	O
of	O	O
preventive	O	O
treatments	O	O
of	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
anaemia	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
was	O	O
conducted	O	O
;	O	O
furthermore	O	O
,	O	O
constraints	O	O
were	O	O
highlighted	O	O
and	O	O
suggestions	O	O
for	O	O
improvement	O	O
were	O	O
provided	O	O
.	O	O

Methods	O	O

3	O	O
.	O	O

Results	O	O
3	O	O
.	O	O
1	O	O
.	O	O

Prevalence	O	O
and	O	O
Burden	O	O
of	O	O
Iron	O	O
Deficiency	O	O
Anaemia	O	O
in	O	O
Pregnancy	O	O
in	O	O
Developing	O	O
Countries	O	O
Worldwide	O	O
,	O	O
anemia	O	O
affects	O	O
over	O	O
two	O	O
billion	O	O
people	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
World	O	O
Health	O	O
Organization	O	O
(	O	O
WHO	O	O
)	O	O
has	O	O
estimated	O	O
that	O	O
half	O	O
of	O	O
these	O	O
are	O	O
due	O	O
to	O	O
iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
[	O	O
5	O	O
,	O	O
6	O	O
].	O	O

Iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
is	O	O
not	O	O
only	O	O
the	O	O
most	O	O
prevalent	O	O
but	O	O
also	O	O
the	O	O
most	O	O
neglected	O	O
nutrient	O	O
deficiency	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
world	O	O
,	O	O
particularly	O	O
among	O	O
pregnant	O	O
women	O	O
and	O	O
children	O	O
in	O	O
developing	O	O
countries	O	O
[	O	O
7	O	O
].	O	O

Presently	O	O
,	O	O
over	O	O

.	O	O

Conclusions	O	O
Iron	O	O
deficiency	O	O
remains	O	O
the	O	O
most	O	O
important	O	O
cause	O	O
of	O	O
anaemia	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
in	O	O
developing	O	O
countries	O	O
.	O	O

Hence	O	O
,	O	O

contribution	O	O
to	O	O
increased	O	O
risks	O	O
of	O	O
low	O	O

weight	O	O
,	O	O
prematurity	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O

.	O	O

Prophylaxis	O	O
iron	O	O
supplement	O	O
and	O	O
food	O	O
fortification	O	O
with	O	O
iron	O	O
have	O	O

of	O	O
improving	O	O
maternal	O	O
and	O	O
child	O	O
health	O	O
,	O	O
except	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
identified	O	O
constraints	O	O
.	O	O

advocacy	O	O
in	O	O
tackling	O	O
micronutrient	O	O
deficiencies	O	O
at	O	O
national	O	O
and	O	O

policy	O	O
levels	O	O

to	O	O

attainment	O	O
of	O	O

Goals	O	O

and	O	O
5	O	O
.	O	O

PubMed	O	O
Central	O	O
:	O	O

High	O	O
Prevalence	O	O
of	O	O
Vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
Deficiency	O	O
in	O	O
Pregnant	O	O
Women	O	O
:	O	O
A	O	O
National	O	O
Cross	O	O
-	O	O
Sectional	O	O
Survey	O	O
Abstract	O	O
An	O	O
increasing	O	O

malformations	O	O
that	O	O
cause	O	O
kyphosis	O	O
or	O	O
scoliosis	O	O
are	O	O
an	O	O
important	O	O
health	O	O
problem	O	O
that	O	O
can	O	O
result	O	O

and	O	O

from	O	O
the	O	O

.	O	O

Congenital	O	O
spine	O	O
deformities	O	O
occur	O	O
with	O	O
an	O	O
approximate	O	O
frequency	O	O
of	O	O
0	O	O
.	O	O
5	O	O
–	O	O
1	O	O
per	O	O
1000	O	O
live	O	O
births	O	O
(	O	O

et	O	O
al	O	O
.	O	O

2011	O	O

may	O	O
arise	O	O
sporadically	O	O
or	O	O
as	O	O

of	O	O

in	O	O
genes	O	O

to	O	O
vertebral	O	O
development	O	O
.	O	O

there	O	O

that	O	O

a	O	O

%	O	O

.	O	O

-	O	O
19	O	O
.	O	O

).	O	O

Conclusions	O	O
Level	O	O
of	O	O
nutritional	O	O
knowledge	O	O
has	O	O
a	O	O
strong	O	O

with	O	O
the	O	O
use	O	O
of	O	O
supplements	O	O
during	O	O

.	O	O

Background	O	O
Adequate	O	O
nutrition	O	O
during	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
is	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
optimal	O	O
foetal	O	O
growth	O	O
[	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
2	O	O
],	O	O

duration	O	O
[	O	O
3	O	O
]	O	O
and	O	O
a	O	O
decrease	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
risk	O	O
of	O	O
congenital	O	O
abnormalities	O	O
[	O	O
4	O	O
].	O	O

A	O	O
lack	O	O
of	O	O
vitamins	O	O
and	O	O
minerals	O	O
can	O	O
adversely	O	O
influence	O	O
the	O	O
newborn	O	O

of	O	O

and	O	O

[	O	O
5	O	O
,	O	O
6	O	O

small	O	O

11	O	O

Background	O	O
Early	O	O
Childhood	O	O
Caries	O	O
(	O	O
ECC	O	O
)	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O

disease	O	O
of	O	O

of	O	O

<	O	O
72	O	O
months	O	O
of	O	O
age	O	O
[	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
2	O	O
].	O	O

Some	O	O
children	O	O
develop	O	O
a	O	O
rampant	O	O

of	O	O
ECC	O	O
termed	O	O

Early	O	O
Childhood	O	O
Caries	O	O
(	O	O
S	O	O
-	O	O
ECC	O	O
),	O	O
a	O	O
condition	O	O
known	O	O
to	O	O
affect	O	O
health	O	O
and	O	O
well	O	O
-	O	O
being	O	O
[	O	O
3	O	O
].	O	O

The	O	O
extent	O	O
of	O	O
decay	O	O
that	O	O
they	O	O

generally	O	O
warrants	O	O

dental	O	O

general	O	O
anesthesia	O	O
(	O	O
GA	O	O
).	O	O

Unfortunately	O	O

dental	O	O

is	O	O
the	O	O
most	O	O
common	O	O
day	O	O

at	O	O
most	O	O
Canadian	O	O

[	O	O
4	O	O
].	O	O

targets	O	O

,	O	O

is	O	O
limited	O	O
.	O	O

of	O	O
life	O	O
is	O	O
reduced	O	O
among	O	O

S	O	O
-	O	O

[	O	O
5	O	O
,	O	O
9	O	O

rampant	O	O

can	O	O

nutritional	O	O
health	O	O

that	O	O

regulates	O	O

levels	O	O

D	O	O

have	O	O

,	O	O
35	O	O
].	O	O

-	O	O

and	O	O

are	O	O

.	O	O

and	O	O
calcium	O	O

development	O	O

for	O	O

.	O	O

with	O	O
S	O	O
-	O	O

may	O	O

This	O	O
can	O	O
improve	O	O
after	O	O
dental	O	O
surgery	O	O
under	O	O
GA	O	O
[	O	O
3	O	O
,	O	O
9	O	O
].	O	O

Avoidance	O	O
of	O	O
food	O	O
because	O	O
of	O	O
severe	O	O
dental	O	O
problems	O	O
may	O	O
,	O	O
in	O	O
turn	O	O
,	O	O
contribute	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
nutritional	O	O
deficiencies	O	O
identified	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
sample	O	O
[	O	O
12	O	O
].	O	O

case	O	O
–	O	O
control	O	O
study	O	O
has	O	O
some	O	O
limitations	O	O
.	O	O

While	O	O
we	O	O
did	O	O
not	O	O
assess	O	O

rates	O	O
,	O	O
all	O	O
children	O	O
with	O	O
S	O	O
-	O	O
ECC	O	O
had	O	O
multiple	O	O
cavitated	O	O

lesions	O	O
necessitating	O	O
surgery	O	O
.	O	O

cross	O	O

did	B	B

Brown	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
activity	O	O
as	O	O
a	O	O
target	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
treatment	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
/	O	O
insulin	O	O
resistance	O	O
Abstract	O	O
Presence	O	O
of	O	O
brown	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
(	O	O
BAT	O	O
),	O	O
characterized	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
expression	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
thermogenic	O	O
uncoupling	O	O
protein	O	O
1	O	O
(	O	O
UCP1	O	O
),	O	O
has	O	O
recently	O	O
been	O	O
described	O	O
in	O	O
adult	O	O
humans	O	O
.	O	O

UCP1	O	O
is	O	O
expressed	O	O
in	O	O
classical	O	O
brown	O	O
adipocytes	O	O
,	O	O
as	O	O
well	O	O
as	O	O
in	O	O
“	O	O
beige	O	O
cells	O	O
”	O	O
in	O	O
white	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
(	O	O
WAT	O	O
).	O	O

The	O	O
thermogenic	O	O
activity	O	O
of	O	O
BAT	O	O
is	O	O
mainly	O	O
controlled	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
sympathetic	O	O
nervous	O	O
system	O	O
.	O	O

Endocrine	O	O
factors	O	O
,	O	O
such	O	O
as	O	O
fibroblast	O	O
growth	O	O
factor	O	O
21	O	O
(	O	O
FGF21	O	O
)	O	O
and	O	O
bone	O	O
morphogenic	O	O
protein	O	O
factor	O	O
-	O	O
9	O	O
(	O	O
BMP	O	O
-	O	O
9	O	O
),	O	O
predominantly	O	O
produced	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
liver	O	O
,	O	O
were	O	O
shown	O	O
to	O	O
lead	O	O
to	O	O
activation	O	O
of	O	O
BAT	O	O
thermogenesis	O	O
,	O	O
as	O	O
well	O	O
as	O	O
to	O	O
“	O	O
browning	O	O
”	O	O
of	O	O
WAT	O	O
.	O	O

This	O	O
was	O	O
also	O	O
observed	O	O
in	O	O
response	O	O
to	O	O
irisin	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
hormone	O	O
secreted	O	O
by	O	O
skeletal	O	O
muscles	O	O
.	O	O

Different	O	O
approaches	O	O
were	O	O
used	O	O
to	O	O
delineate	O	O
the	O	O
impact	O	O
of	O	O
UCP1	O	O
on	O	O
insulin	O	O
sensitivity	O	O
.	O	O

When	O	O
studied	O	O
under	O	O
thermoneutral	O	O
conditions	O	O
,	O	O
UCP1	O	O
knockout	O	O
mice	O	O
exhibited	O	O
markedly	O	O
increased	O	O
metabolic	O	O
efficiency	O	O
due	O	O
to	O	O
impaired	O	O
thermogenesis	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
impact	O	O
of	O	O
UCP1	O	O
deletion	O	O
on	O	O
insulin	O	O
sensitivity	O	O
in	O	O
these	O	O
mice	O	O
was	O	O
not	O	O
reported	O	O
.	O	O

Conversely	O	O
,	O	O
several	O	O
studies	O	O
in	O	O
both	O	O
rodents	O	O
and	O	O
humans	O	O
have	O	O
shown	O	O
that	O	O
BAT	O	O
activation	O	O
(	O	O
by	O	O
cold	O	O
exposure	O	O
,	O	O
β3	O	O
-	O	O
agonist	O	O
treatment	O	O
,	O	O
transplantation	O	O
and	O	O
others	O	O
)	O	O
improves	O	O
glucose	O	O
tolerance	O	O
and	O	O
insulin	O	O
sensitivity	O	O
.	O	O

Interestingly	O	O
,	O	O
similar	O	O
results	O	O
were	O	O
obtained	O	O
by	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
-	O	O
specific	O	O
overexpression	O	O
of	O	O
PR	O	O
-	O	O
domain	O	O
-	O	O
containing	O	O
16	O	O
(	O	O
PRDM16	O	O
)	O	O
or	O	O
BMP4	O	O
in	O	O
mice	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O

such	O	O

to	O	O

,	O	O

-	O	O

and	O	O

D2	O	O
synthase	O	O
.	O	O

Interestingly	O	O
,	O	O

of	O	O

secreted	O	O
by	O	O

itself	O	O
,	O	O

the	O	O
occurrence	O	O
of	O	O
autocrine	O	O
effects	O	O
.	O	O

Stimulation	O	O
of	O	O
BAT	O	O
activity	O	O
and	O	O
/	O	O
or	O	O
recruitment	O	O
of	O	O
UCP1	O	O
-	O	O
positive	O	O
cells	O	O
are	O	O
therefore	O	O
relevant	O	O
targets	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
treatment	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
/	O	O
type	O	O
2	O	O
diabetes	O	O
in	O	O
humans	O	O
.	O	O

Introduction	O	O
Obesity	O	O
,	O	O
well	O	O
known	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
comorbidities	O	O
,	O	O
including	O	O
insulin	O	O
resistance	O	O
and	O	O
type	O	O
2	O	O
diabetes	O	O
,	O	O
has	O	O
become	O	O
a	O	O
major	O	O
public	O	O
health	O	O
problem	O	O
in	O	O
recent	O	O
decades	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
has	O	O
reached	O	O
epidemic	O	O
proportions	O	O
,	O	O
not	O	O
only	O	O
in	O	O
high	O	O
-	O	O
income	O	O
countries	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
also	O	O
in	O	O
most	O	O
middle	O	O
-	O	O
income	O	O
societies	O	O
.	O	O

It	O	O
is	O	O
defined	O	O
as	O	O
an	O	O
accumulation	O	O
of	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
that	O	O
is	O	O
of	O	O
sufficient	O	O
magnitude	O	O
to	O	O
impair	O	O
health	O	O
(	O	O
WHO	O	O
,	O	O
2014	O	O
).	O	O

Excess	O	O
weight	O	O
is	O	O
usually	O	O
defined	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
body	O	O
mass	O	O
index	O	O
or	O	O
BMI	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
normal	O	O
BMI	O	O
range	O	O
is	O	O
18	O	O
.	O	O
5	O	O
–	O	O
25	O	O
kg	O	O
/	O	O
m2	O	O
,	O	O
although	O	O
the	O	O
range	O	O
may	O	O
vary	O	O
for	O	O
different	O	O
countries	O	O
.	O	O

Individuals	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
BMI	O	O
above	O	O
30	O	O
kg	O	O
/	O	O
m2are	O	O
classified	O	O
as	O	O
obese	O	O
;	O	O
those	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
BMI	O	O
between	O	O
25	O	O
and	O	O
30	O	O
kg	O	O
/	O	O
m2are	O	O
considered	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
overweight	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
general	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
term	O	O
obesity	O	O
applies	O	O
to	O	O
both	O	O
the	O	O
obese	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
overweight	O	O
subjects	O	O
.	O	O

More	O	O
than	O	O
the	O	O
total	O	O
body	O	O
weight	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
distribution	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
stored	O	O
fat	O	O
is	O	O
of	O	O
importance	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
development	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
and	O	O
its	O	O
comorbidities	O	O
.	O	O

Thus	O	O
,	O	O
central	O	O
or	O	O
visceral	O	O
obesity	O	O
,	O	O
in	O	O
which	O	O
fat	O	O
accumulates	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
trunk	O	O
and	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
abdominal	O	O
cavity	O	O
(	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
mesentery	O	O
and	O	O
around	O	O
the	O	O
viscera	O	O
),	O	O
is	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
much	O	O
higher	O	O
risk	O	O
for	O	O
several	O	O
diseases	O	O
than	O	O
excess	O	O
subcutaneous	O	O
fat	O	O
accumulation	O	O
.	O	O

Obesity	O	O
has	O	O
profound	O	O
effects	O	O
on	O	O
tissue	O	O
insulin	O	O
sensitivity	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
therefore	O	O
on	O	O
systemic	O	O
glucose	O	O
homeostasis	O	O
.	O	O

Insulin	O	O
resistance	O	O
is	O	O
present	O	O
even	O	O
in	O	O
simple	O	O
obesity	O	O
,	O	O
without	O	O
hyperglycemia	O	O
,	O	O
indicating	O	O
a	O	O
fundamental	O	O
abnormality	O	O
of	O	O
insulin	O	O
signaling	O	O
in	O	O
states	O	O
of	O	O
excess	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
mass	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
epidemiologic	O	O
association	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
,	O	O
particularly	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
visceral	O	O
type	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
type	O	O
2	O	O
diabetes	O	O
has	O	O
been	O	O
recognized	O	O
for	O	O
decades	O	O
.	O	O

According	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
World	O	O
Health	O	O
Organization	O	O
,	O	O
347	O	O
millions	O	O
of	O	O
people	O	O
are	O	O
diabetic	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
world	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
predicted	O	O
that	O	O
in	O	O
2030	O	O

will	O	O
be	O	O
the	O	O
7th	O	O
cause	O	O
of	O	O
death	O	O
considering	O	O
the	O	O
worldwide	O	O
population	O	O
(	O	O
WHO	O	O
,	O	O
2014	O	O
).	O	O

Although	O	O

of	O	O

is	O	O

and	O	O
/	O	O

energy	O	O

.	O	O

Despite	O	O

in	O	O

are	O	O

treatment	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
and	O	O
its	O	O
comorbidities	O	O
.	O	O

Targeting	O	O
specific	O	O
components	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O

regulation	O	O
of	O	O
energy	O	O

or	O	O

unsuccessful	B	B

.	O	O

New	O	O

on	O	O

tissue	O	O

in	O	O
the	O	O

.	O	O

Two	O	O
different	O	O
types	O	O
of	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
described	O	O
:	O	O
brown	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
(	O	O
BAT	O	O
),	O	O
composed	O	O
mainly	O	O
of	O	O
brown	O	O
adipocytes	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
white	O	O
adipose	O	O
tissue	O	O
(	O	O
WAT	O	O
),	O	O
defined	O	O
by	O	O
a	O	O
majority	O	O
of	O	O
white	O	O
adipocytes	O	O
,	O	O
both	O	O
tissues	O	O
being	O	O

to	O	O
accumulate	O	O
lipids	O	O
in	O	O
intracellular	O	O
droplets	O	O
.	O	O

WAT	O	O
is	O	O
an	O	O
energy	O	O
-	O	O
storing	O	O
tissue	O	O
that	O	O
has	O	O
evolutionary	O	O
enabled	O	O
humans	O	O
to	O	O
survive	O	O
for	O	O
longer	O	O
periods	O	O
between	O	O
meals	O	O
,	O	O
storing	O	O
energy	O	O
mainly	O	O
as	O	O
triglycerides	O	O
and	O	O
releasing	O	O
fatty	O	O
acids	O	O
during	O	O
fasting	O	O
periods	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
recent	O	O
times	O	O
,	O	O
when	O	O
food	O	O
has	O	O
become	O	O
cheaper	O	O
and	O	O
more	O	O
widely	O	O
available	O	O
,	O	O

storage	O	O

worldwide	O	O

development	O	O
of	O	O
obesity	O	O
mentioned	O	O
above	O	O
(	O	O
World	O	O
Health	O	O
Organization	O	O
,	O	O
2009	O	O
).	O	O

White	O	O
adipocytes	O	O
are	O	O
composed	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
large	O	O
single	O	O
,	O	O
spherical	O	O
lipid	O	O

and	O	O
a	O	O

located	O	O
nucleus	O	O
,	O	O
together	O	O
with	O	O
few	O	O
mitochondria	O	O
.	O	O

WAT	O	O
has	O	O
endocrine	O	O
activity	O	O
,	O	O
secreting	O	O
several	O	O
factors	O	O
and	O	O
hormones	O	O

such	O	O
as	O	O
leptin	O	O
and	O	O
adiponectin	O	O
.	O	O

Under	O	O
certain	O	O

,	O	O
another	O	O
type	O	O
of	O	O

.	O	O

These	O	O
cells	O	O

which	O	O
will	O	O
be	O	O
discussed	O	O
below	O	O

present	O	O
a	O	O

with	O	O

are	O	O
closest	O	O
to	O	O

than	O	O

white	O	O
adipocytes	O	O
.	O	O

BAT	O	O
consists	O	O
in	O	O
brown	O	O
adipocytes	O	O

by	O	O
multiple	O	O

a	O	O

number	O	O
of	O	O
mitochondria	O	O
.	O	O

BAT	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
highly	O	O
vascularized	O	O
tissue	O	O
innervated	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
sympathetic	O	O

system	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
mitochondria	O	O
of	O	O

are	O	O
characterized	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
presence	O	O
of	O	O
uncoupling	O	O
protein	O	O
-	O	O

(	O	O

)	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O

membrane	O	O
.	O	O

When	O	O
activated	O	O

from	O	O

in	O	O
heat	O	O
production	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
process	O	O
that	O	O
consumes	O	O
substantial	O	O
amounts	O	O
of	O	O
fuels	O	O
.	O	O

BAT	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
principal	O	O
effector	O	O
organ	O	O
of	O	O
non	O	O
-	O	O
shivering	O	O
thermogenesis	O	O
(	O	O
i	O	O
.	O	O
e	O	O
.,	O	O
heat	O	O
production	O	O
that	O	O
does	O	O
not	O	O
involve	O	O
skeletal	O	O
muscle	O	O
contraction	O	O
),	O	O
is	O	O
present	O	O
in	O	O
most	O	O
mammals	O	O
and	O	O

maturation	O	O
in	O	O

varies	O	O
between	O	O
species	O	O
,	O	O

to	O	O
their	O	O
developmental	O	O
status	O	O
at	O	O
birth	O	O
(	O	O

and	O	O
Wabitsch	O	O
,	O	O
2011	O	O

In	O	O

of	O	O

during	O	O

first	O	O
9	O	O
months	O	O
(	O	O
Lean	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
1986	O	O
;	O	O

and	O	O
Wabitsch	O	O
,	O	O
2011	O	O
).	O	O

is	O	O
solely	O	O
apparent	O	O
during	O	O

for	O	O
decades	O	O
(	O	O

,	O	O
1972	O	O
;	O	O
Nedergaard	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2007	O	O
).	O	O

in	O	O

emission	O	O

(	O	O

-	O	O

(	O	O
Cypess	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2009	O	O
;	O	O
van	O	O
Marken	O	O

et	O	O
al	O	O

2009	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2009	O	O
).	O	O

The	O	O
areas	O	O

which	O	O

in	O	O
adult	O	O

(	O	O

.,	O	O

that	O	O

have	O	O

,	O	O
50	O	O
–	O	O
80	O	O
g	O	O
of	O	O

(	O	O

et	O	O

that	O	O
50	O	O
g	O	O
of	O	O
BAT	O	O
can	O	O
burn	O	O
as	O	O

as	O	O
20	O	O

of	O	O

63	O	O

1	O	O

of	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2009	O	O
).	O	O

are	O	O

tissue	O	O

to	O	O

contribute	O	O
to	O	O
energy	O	O

(	O	O

et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2007	O	O
).	O	O

BAT	O	O
activity	O	O
is	O	O
well	O	O
known	O	O
to	O	O
mostly	O	O

on	O	O
lipid	O	O
metabolism	O	O
,	O	O
UCP1	O	O
being	O	O
directly	O	O
activated	O	O
by	O	O
fatty	O	O
acids	O	O
(	O	O

and	O	O
Nedergaard	O	O
,	O	O
2004	O	O
).	O	O

Along	O	O
this	O	O
line	O	O
,	O	O
it	O	O
was	O	O
recently	O	O
demonstrated	O	O
that	O	O
chronic	O	O
activation	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O

induces	O	O
coupled	O	O

,	O	O

novo	O	O

and	O	O
fatty	O	O

not	O	O
only	O	O
in	O	O
white	O	O

also	O	O
in	O	O
BAT	O	O
(	O	O
Mottillo	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2014	O	O
).	O	O

Thus	O	O

the	O	O
continuous	O	O
cycling	O	O
of	O	O
triglyceride	O	O
hydrolysis	O	O
coupled	O	O
to	O	O
resynthesis	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
requires	O	O
large	O	O
amounts	O	O
of	O	O

could	O	O
be	O	O
another	O	O

to	O	O
increase	O	O

to	O	O
the	O	O

of	O	O

activation	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
process	O	O
(	O	O
Mottillo	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2014	O	O
).	O	O

Similarly	O	O
to	O	O
what	O	O
was	O	O
proposed	O	O
for	O	O
skeletal	O	O
muscle	O	O
(	O	O
Dulloo	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2004	O	O
),	O	O
this	O	O
may	O	O

lipids	O	O

this	O	O
protein	O	O
and	O	O
its	O	O
role	O	O
in	O	O
humans	O	O
is	O	O
still	O	O
a	O	O
matter	O	O
of	O	O
debate	O	O
(	O	O
Elsen	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2014a	O	O
).	O	O

Thyroid	O	O
hormones	O	O
(	O	O
THs	O	O
)	O	O
are	O	O
well	O	O
known	O	O
mediators	O	O
of	O	O
overall	O	O
energy	O	O
expenditure	O	O
(	O	O
Klieverik	O	O
et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
2009	O	O
).	O	O

Treatment	O	O
with	O	O
THs	O	O
induces	O	O
UCP1	O	O
expression	O	O
in	O	O
brown	O	O
adipocytes	O	O

rats	O	O

their	O	O

to	O	O

-	O	O
responsive	O	O
elements	O	O
in	O	O

(	O	O

et	O	O
al	O	O
.,	O	O
1996	O	O
).	O	O

Type	O	O
2	O	O
iodothyronine	O	O
deiodinase	O	O
(	O	O
D2	O	O
),	O	O
responsible	O	O
for	O	O

of	O	O

(	O	O

to	O	O

(	O	O

),	O	O
is	O	O
also	O	O
inducing	O	O
UCP1	O	O
expression	O	O
locally	O	O
,	O	O
in	O	O
BAT	O	O
(	O	O
de	O	O
Jesus	O	O
et	O	O

.,	O	O
2001	O	O
).	O	O

Furthermore	O	O
,	O	O
treatment	O	O
of	O	O

and	O	O
human	O	O

(	O	O

to	O	O

D2	O	O
activity	O	O
and	O	O
oxygen	O	O
consumption	O	O

of	O	O

(	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2006	O	O

In	O	O

rodents	O	O

Thyroid	O	O
receptors	O	O
(	O	O

)	O	O
are	O	O
composed	O	O
of	O	O

that	O	O
specifically	O	O
regulate	O	O

and	O	O
thermogenesis	O	O

The	O	O
α	O	O

was	O	O
shown	O	O
to	O	O
regulate	O	O
adaptive	O	O
thermogenesis	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2001	O	O
).	O	O

In	O	O
humans	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
unique	O	O
patient	O	O
suffering	O	O
from	O	O
extreme	O	O

of	O	O

.	O	O

study	O	O

of	O	O

.	O	O

(	O	O

of	O	O

as	O	O

(	O	O

.	O	O

Phosphatase	O	O
and	O	O

homolog	O	O
deleted	O	O
on	O	O
chromosome	O	O

(	O	O

of	O	O

5	O	O

triphosphate	O	O
(	O	O

),	O	O

enzyme	O	O

.	O	O

of	O	O

to	O	O

of	O	O
FOXO	O	O
transcription	O	O
factors	O	O
(	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2012	O	O
).	O	O

of	O	O

(	O	O

)	O	O

authors	O	O

present	O	O

energy	O	O

expression	O	O
of	O	O

as	O	O

of	O	O
its	O	O
transcriptional	O	O
regulator	O	O
,	O	O
PGC1	O	O
-	O	O
α	O	O
(	O	O

et	O	O

.,	O	O
2012	O	O
).	O	O

of	O	O

in	O	O
the	O	O
liver	O	O

LPTENKO	O	O
mice	O	O
induces	O	O
a	O	O
strong	O	O
hepatic	O	O
steatosis	O	O
(	O	O

et	O	O

sensitivity	O	O
,	O	O

Introduction	O	O

is	O	O

.	O	O

Discussion	O	O
The	O	O
etiology	O	O
of	O	O
autism	O	O
is	O	O
unknown	O	O
,	O	O
although	O	O
perinatal	O	O
and	O	O
neonatal	O	O
exposures	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
the	O	O
focus	O	O
of	O	O
recent	O	O
epidemiologic	O	O
research	O	O
[	O	O
57	O	O
].	O	O

Exposure	O	O
to	O	O
certain	O	O
medications	O	O
such	O	O
as	O	O
perinatal	O	O
medications	O	O
,	O	O
antiepileptic	O	O
drugs	O	O
,	O	O
supplements	O	O

and	O	O
SSRIs	O	O
has	O	O
been	O	O
studied	O	O
as	O	O
well	O	O
as	O	O
drug	O	O
exposure	O	O
to	O	O
cocaine	O	O
and	O	O
smoking	O	O
.	O	O

Artificial	O	O
insemination	O	O
and	O	O
fertility	O	O
medications	O	O
,	O	O
meconium	O	O
aspiration	O	O
syndrome	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
birth	O	O
weight	O	O
have	O	O
also	O	O
all	O	O
been	O	O
subjects	O	O
of	O	O
focus	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
respective	O	O
association	O	O
with	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
and	O	O
neurodevelopmental	O	O
complications	O	O
such	O	O
as	O	O
autism	O	O
.	O	O

Several	O	O
studies	O	O
have	O	O
suggested	O	O
the	O	O
association	O	O
between	O	O
perinatal	O	O
factors	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
onset	O	O
of	O	O
autism	O	O
.	O	O

A	O	O
recent	O	O
case	O	O
control	O	O
study	O	O
done	O	O
in	O	O
New	O	O
South	O	O
Wales	O	O
,	O	O
Australia	O	O
,	O	O
focused	O	O
on	O	O
determining	O	O
risk	O	O
factors	O	O
for	O	O
autism	O	O
.	O	O

Four	O	O
factors	O	O
were	O	O
shown	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
significantly	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
autism	O	O

being	O	O
male	O	O
,	O	O
premature	O	O
birth	O	O
,	O	O
maternal	O	O
age	O	O
greater	O	O
than	O	O
or	O	O
equal	O	O
to	O	O
35	O	O
years	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
mothers	O	O
born	O	O
outside	O	O
of	O	O
Australia	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
highest	O	O
risk	O	O
found	O	O
in	O	O
mothers	O	O
from	O	O
North	O	O
-	O	O
East	O	O
or	O	O
South	O	O
-	O	O
East	O	O
Asia	O	O
[	O	O
7	O	O
].	O	O

A	O	O
separate	O	O
study	O	O
from	O	O
Western	O	O
Australia	O	O
concluded	O	O
that	O	O
autistic	O	O
children	O	O
generally	O	O
had	O	O
parents	O	O
who	O	O
were	O	O
older	O	O
and	O	O
had	O	O
greater	O	O
frequencies	O	O
of	O	O
threatened	O	O
abortions	O	O
,	O	O
epidural	O	O

SSRIs	O	O

[	O	O

.	O	O

Meconium	O	O
Aspiration	O	O
Syndrome	O	O
Meconium	O	O
aspiration	O	O
syndrome	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
occurs	O	O
when	O	O
a	O	O
fetus	O	O
who	O	O
is	O	O
under	O	O
stress	O	O
and	O	O
not	O	O
getting	O	O
enough	O	O
oxygen	O	O
inhales	O	O
waste	O	O
products	O	O
inside	O	O
the	O	O
womb	O	O
,	O	O
was	O	O
linked	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
sevenfold	O	O
increase	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
likelihood	O	O
that	O	O
a	O	O
child	O	O
would	O	O
later	O	O
develop	O	O

study	O	O
examined	O	O

of	O	O

connected	O	O
with	O	O
autistic	O	O

.	O	O

in	O	O
this	O	O
study	O	O
indicate	O	O
that	O	O

with	O	O
autism	O	O
had	O	O
a	O	O
significantly	O	O
higher	O	O
history	O	O
of	O	O
meconium	O	O
aspiration	O	O
syndrome	O	O
than	O	O
the	O	O
controls	O	O
[	O	O
43	O	O
].	O	O

However	O	O
,	O	O
there	O	O
is	O	O
insufficient	O	O
evidence	O	O
to	O	O
implicate	O	O

conditions	O	O

risk	O	O
.	O	O

participants	O	O

3	O	O

Sample	O	O
Size	O	O
Estimation	O	O

to	O	O
0	O	O

in	O	O

of	O	O

regression	O	O
models	O	O
were	O	O

.	O	O

differences	O	O
in	O	O
metabolic	O	O
markers	O	O
were	O	O

using	O	O
the	O	O
equation	O	O
:	O	O
([	O	O
eB	O	O
-	O	O
1	O	O
]*	O	O
100	O	O
).	O	O

supplementation	O	O
,	O	O
whereas	O	O
rs12785878	O	O
and	O	O
rs6013897	O	O
(	O	O

)	O	O
were	O	O
not	O	O
.	O	O

Conclusions	O	O
:	O	O
Genetic	O	O
variation	O	O
in	O	O

,	O	O
which	O	O
encodes	O	O
7	O	O
-	O	O
dehyrocholesterol	O	O
reductase	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
epidermal	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
biosynthesis	O	O
pathway	O	O

appears	O	O
to	O	O
modify	O	O
baseline	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
.	O	O

contrast	O	O

response	O	O
to	O	O
antenatal	O	O

supplementation	O	O
was	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
SNPs	O	O
in	O	O

vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
binding	O	O
protein	O	O
synthesis	O	O
or	O	O

.	O	O

Abstract	O	O
:	O	O
TEASER	O	O
Associations	O	O
between	O	O
SNPs	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
metabolism	O	O
pathway	O	O
and	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
were	O	O
assessed	O	O
before	O	O
and	O	O
after	O	O
antenatal	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
supplementation	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
associations	O	O
differed	O	O
at	O	O
the	O	O
two	O	O
time	O	O
points	O	O
.	O	O

Antenatal	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
supplementation	O	O
is	O	O
now	O	O
recommended	O	O
for	O	O
all	O	O
pregnant	O	O
women	O	O
in	O	O
many	O	O
national	O	O
guidelines	O	O
(	O	O
1	O	O
–	O	O
3	O	O
)	O	O
as	O	O
severe	O	O
maternal	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
deficiency	O	O
can	O	O
result	O	O
in	O	O
symptomatic	O	O
neonatal	O	O
hypocalcemia	O	O
(	O	O
4	O	O
).	O	O

Furthermore	O	O
,	O	O
associations	O	O
between	O	O
maternal	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
status	O	O
and	O	O
obstetric	O	O
complications	O	O
(	O	O
4	O	O
)	O	O
and	O	O
offspring	O	O
musculoskeletal	O	O
development	O	O
(	O	O
5	O	O
–	O	O
7	O	O
)	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
reported	O	O
.	O	O

Risk	O	O
factors	O	O
for	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
deficiency	O	O
,	O	O
in	O	O
addition	O	O
to	O	O
geographic	O	O
and	O	O
seasonal	O	O
variation	O	O
,	O	O
are	O	O
well	O	O
established	O	O
.	O	O

These	O	O
include	O	O
ethnicity	O	O
,	O	O
extent	O	O
of	O	O
skin	O	O
covering	O	O
,	O	O
liberal	O	O
use	O	O
of	O	O
sun	O	O
protection	O	O
,	O	O
adiposity	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
age	O	O
.	O	O

It	O	O
is	O	O
also	O	O
increasingly	O	O
recognized	O	O
that	O	O
genetic	O	O
variation	O	O
influences	O	O
25	O	O
-	O	O
hydroxyvitamin	O	O
D	O	O
[	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
]	O	O
status	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
a	O	O
previous	O	O
genome	O	O
-	O	O
wide	O	O
association	O	O
study	O	O
(	O	O
GWAS	O	O
),	O	O
we	O	O
demonstrated	O	O
that	O	O
a	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
single	O	O
-	O	O
nucleotide	O	O
polymorphisms	O	O
(	O	O

)	O	O
in	O	O
or	O	O
near	O	O
to	O	O
genes	O	O
encoding	O	O
key	O	O
components	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
metabolism	O	O
pathway	O	O
are	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
serum	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
level	O	O
(	O	O
8	O	O
).	O	O

These	O	O
include	O	O
DHCR7	O	O
encoding	O	O
7	O	O
-	O	O
dehydrocholesterol	O	O
(	O	O
7	O	O
-	O	O
DHC	O	O
)	O	O
reductase	O	O
;	O	O
CYP2R1	O	O
and	O	O
CYP24A1	O	O
encoding	O	O
25	O	O
-	O	O
hydroxylase	O	O
and	O	O
24	O	O
-	O	O
hydroxylase	O	O
,	O	O
respectively	O	O
;	O	O
and	O	O
GC	O	O
encoding	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
binding	O	O
protein	O	O
(	O	O
VDP	O	O
).	O	O

Several	O	O
of	O	O
these	O	O
SNPs	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
the	O	O
serum	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
increase	O	O
in	O	O
response	O	O
to	O	O
vitamin	O	O
D	O	O
supplementation	O	O
in	O	O
small	O	O
studies	O	O
(	O	O
9	O	O
–	O	O
11	O	O
).	O	O

Pregnancy	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
physiologically	O	O
unique	O	O
period	O	O
,	O	O
involving	O	O
hemodilution	O	O
and	O	O

For	O	O

rises	O	O
early	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
1	O	O
,	O	O
25	O	O
-	O	O
dihydroxyvitamin	O	O

increases	O	O
during	O	O

second	O	O
and	O	O
third	O	O

(	O	O
12	O	O
).	O	O

Supplementation	O	O
with	O	O
cholecalciferol	O	O
increases	O	O
maternal	O	O
serum	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
concentration	O	O
(	O	O
7	O	O
),	O	O
and	O	O
we	O	O
have	O	O
previously	O	O
demonstrated	O	O
that	O	O
the	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
achieved	O	O
in	O	O
response	O	O
to	O	O
supplementation	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
is	O	O
associated	O	O
with	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
weight	O	O
gain	O	O
,	O	O
compliance	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
baseline	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
(	O	O
13	O	O
).	O	O

In	O	O
the	O	O
previous	O	O
study	O	O

contrast	O	O
to	O	O

were	O	O

with	O	O

to	O	O

supplementation	O	O
in	O	O
pregnancy	O	O
(	O	O
13	O	O
).	O	O

to	O	O

vitamin	O	O

genetic	O	O

associated	O	O
with	O	O
baseline	O	O
serum	O	O
25	O	O
(	O	O
OH	O	O
)	O	O
D	O	O
status	O	O
and	O	O

antenatal	O	O

Background	O	O

pathology	O	O
is	O	O
often	O	O

the	O	O

1	O	O
].	O	O

complex	B	B
and	O	O

[	O	O
8	O	O
].	O	O

In	O	O

to	O	O

[	O	O
9	O	O
],	O	O
placenta	O	O

[	O	O
10	O	O
]	O	O
and	O	O

factors	O	O
affect	O	O

growth	O	O
in	O	O
utero	O	O
[	O	O
9	O	O
],	O	O
and	O	O
maternal	O	O

on	O	O

and	O	O
development	O	O
[	O	O
11	O	O
].	O	O

that	O	O

that	O	O
high	O	O
-	O	O
quality	O	O

of	O	O

between	O	O

Activity	O	O

(	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O
3	O	O
.	O	O

Statistical	O	O

was	O	O
mentioned	O	O

principal	O	O
